xdsp::CircularBuffer< T > Class Template Reference

Circular buffer. More...

#include <CircularBuffer.h>

Public Member Functions

 CircularBuffer ()
 Construct a new circular buffer.
This does not yet allocate memory.
Call init() or init_power_of_two() before pushing data!
 
void init (unsigned int size)
 Initialize the circular buffer with a given (minumum) size.
Actual buffer size will be the next greater power of 2, for reasons of efficiency.
All samples will be set to zero.
 
void clear ()
 Clear the buffer.
Sets all content bytes to zero.
 
void push_sample (T x)
 Push a sample into the buffer.
Wraps around and overwrites when buffer is full.
 
T read (int delay)
 Reads sample from buffer with given delay regarding write index.
 
T read (double delay_fractional)
 Reads sample from the buffer with given fractional delay regarding write index.
Samples are linearly interpolated.
 

Detailed Description

template<typename T>
class xdsp::CircularBuffer< T >

Circular buffer.

Template Parameters
TNumeric type of the buffer samples.
Single or double precision floating-point or integral type.

◆ init()

template<typename T >
void xdsp::CircularBuffer< T >::init ( unsigned int size)

Initialize the circular buffer with a given (minumum) size.
Actual buffer size will be the next greater power of 2, for reasons of efficiency.
All samples will be set to zero.

Important
This function allocates memory - NOT REAL-TIME SAFE!
Parameters
size(Minimum) number of samples

Definition at line 17 of file CircularBuffer.cc.

17 {
18 init_power_of_two((unsigned int)(pow(2, ceil(log(size) / log(2)))));
19}
